competitors.name: HomeCourt

whatTheyClaim.keyDifferentiator: Official NBA partner, gamified AR experience

glitches: Camera tracking inconsistent in poor lighting
userComplaints: Overwhelming focus on gamification vs actual skill development
Works best indoors with perfect lighting
Shot detection misses frequently on outdoor courts
whatTheyDontDoWell.marketPositioning: Too focused on 'fun' vs serious development
whatTheyDontDoWell.targetAudienceMismatch: Kids love it, parents question ROI, coaches find it distracting

courtLabAdvantage: No gimmicks — straight data and video
Verified combines (QR scan) — objective truth, not AI guesswork
Built for clubs/teams, not just individuals
Lower price point for serious features
competitors.notes: Biggest competitor. NBA brand is powerful. But bloated with features that don't serve serious development. CourtLab's 'no BS data' angle is the counter.

competitors.name: Pure Sweat Basketball

whatTheyClaim.primary: Educational videos and workouts from elite coaches
features: Video library of drills and instruction
whatTheyClaim.keyDifferentiator: Content from respected coach Drew Hanlen

glitches: New app (2023) — still working out bugs
userComplaints: 'Paying for skills training other than personal trainer is waste — YouTube has same stuff free'
No verified data or stats tracking
whatTheyDontDoWell.marketPositioning: Content library, not a tracking tool
whatTheyDontDoWell.targetAudienceMismatch: Coaches want tools, not just content

courtLabAdvantage: We track actual performance data, not just time spent
Video engine with clipping (not just consumption)
competitors.notes: Different category — they're content, we're data/infrastructure. Not a direct competitor but addresses same market. Their weakness (no tracking) is our strength.

competitors.name: Ballogy

glitches: App is 'not user friendly at all'
Won't filter to only my groups/followers

courtLabAdvantage: Simple — tap for makes, hold for misses
No AI guesswork — verified human combines
Built by a coach who understands clubs
competitors.notes: Closest feature competitor. But glitchy, expensive, and complicated. CourtLab's 'stability first' approach is the contrast.

competitors.name: DribbleUp

whatTheyClaim.primary: Smart basketball + app for home training
features: Computer vision tracking via phone camera

glitches: 'Took a few tries to get accuracy'
userComplaints: Monthly subscription on top of hardware cost
Not suitable for serious players — too basic
Focus on dribbling only (not shooting/game skills)
whatTheyDontDoWell.marketPositioning: Toy for beginners, not tool for serious athletes
whatTheyDontDoWell.targetAudienceMismatch: Parents buy for young kids, but serious players need more

courtLabAdvantage: No hardware required — works with any ball
competitors.notes: Different segment — they're beginner/hobby, we're serious development. But parents compare them. Our angle: 'When your kid is ready to get serious, switch to CourtLab.'

competitors.name: BasketballConnect

glitches: Forced transition from Gameday confused users
userComplaints: Focus on administration, not player development
Parents forced to use it, don't like it
whatTheyDontDoWell.targetAudienceMismatch: Clubs need it for compliance, but doesn't help coaches train better

courtLabAdvantage: We focus on player development, not just administration
competitors.notes: Not a direct competitor — they're admin/compliance, we're development/training. But every SA club already has BasketballConnect. Our pitch: 'Use BasketballConnect for registration, CourtLab for development.'

summary.differentiation: Stability, verified data, coach-first design, no gimmicks
summary.pricingAdvantage: Lower than HomeCourt/Ballogy for serious features
summary.marketGap: Serious development tool without AI gimmicks or hardware requirements

strategyNotes.vsHomeCourt: Counter their 'fun/games' with 'serious data'. CourtLab is for athletes, not gamers.
strategyNotes.vsBallogy: Counter their 'glitchy AI' with 'verified human combines'. Stability beats complexity.
strategyNotes.vsDribbleUp: Counter 'toy for beginners' with 'tool for serious players'. Natural progression.
strategyNotes.vsPureSweat: Counter 'content library' with 'data tracking'. We're infrastructure, not entertainment.
strategyNotes.vsBasketballConnect: Partner, don't compete. They're admin, we're development.
